content:
This standard describes definitions and general requirements for labeling of products and packaging.

|   Section | Changes                                                                    |
|----------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|       5.4 | Heading updated in Table 11 to: Household products, furniture and bedding. |

The terms and definitions in Table 1 apply for the purpose of this document.

| Term                                                          | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|:--------------------------------------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| JYSK languages                                                | The languages in the listed order according to list in JYSK General Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Barcode                                                       | A machine-readable code according to 1.3 consisting of: « EAN13 barcode * GTIN number                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Batch number                                                  | Identification of the week and year of the final packing. Batch numbers must follow the format WWYY: e WW is week of final packaging (e.g. “07” for week number 7) e YYis the year of final packaging (e.g. “21” for year 2021) in which the product is produced stated in the format:                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Country of origin                                             | Country ‘Made in X’ where X is the country. Note: special requirement for the Arabic language see 3. A unit containing one or several sales units (or in some cases smaller handling units) packaged for                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Handling units                                                | distribution. Handling units can be in the form of e.g. cardboard box, a plastic bag or foiled pre-packs. JYSK company information consists of Company name, Legal address, Phone number, Electronic address and number:

|

| JYSK UK-importer Information* JYSK Morocco-                   | JYSK Ltd. Type “JYSK Morocco importer information” in the Definition field and press enter.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| JYSK Switzerland importer information                         | JYSK GmbH Untere BruhlstraBe 4 CH-4800 Zofingen Note: Only required for CLP (pictogram and/or hazard/precautionary statements) labeled products. Must be cleared with JYSK C&Q                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| JYSK Tiirkiye importer information for food contact materials | Gida ile temasa uygundur . | | | Ithalatci: JYSK EV URUNLERI PERAKENDE TICARET ANONIM SIRKETI. Adresi

: Cevizli Mah. Tugay Yolu Cad. No: 69 Maltepe Piazza Maltepe/istanbul. Mensei: [Country of origin in Turkish language] Note: Only required for products with intended or foreseeable food contact. Text in “[ ]” must be replaced with the country of origin in Turkish Language. Translation can be found in JYSK Term database. Alternative line breaks, see 3.2. |
| Material content                                              | Description of main materials in the product. For textile products the material content is the fiber-composition according to JYSK 4004                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Product dimension                                             | The nominal dimension of product after assembly.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Product name                                                  | The name of the product provided by JYSK.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| Product number                                                | The reference number of the product in JYSK ERP system. The format of product numbers must comply with 1.1.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| Product type                                                  | The type of product according to JYSK terminology (JYSK Term Database).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

Note: Order numbers are 10 digits in the format ‘45XXXXXXXX’.

A sales unit may consist of separate components.

Note: Some sales units also act as handling units.

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Note: *Alternative line breaks, see 3.1.

JYSK product number must follow the format stated in Table 2.

| Applicable region:    | Product number format:   |
|:----------------------|:-------------------------|
| Global (Nordic & DBL) | NNNNNNN/DDDDDDDD         |
| Nordic only           | NNNNNNN                  |

• NNNNNNN is the Nordic product number (7 digits)

DDDDDDDD is the DBL product number (8 digits)

Note: JYSK use two product numbers on global products due to separate ERP (SAP) systems in Nordic and DBL.

DBL numbers can only be created after:

1) The PIF has been returned and approved by JYSK.

2) The product is listed for DBL region.

JYSK will not be able to inform the DBL numbers until the day after above has been met.

JYSK supplier number must follow the format stated in Table 3.

| 0                  | 1        | 2      | 3       |
|:-------------------|:---------|:-------|:--------|
| Applicable region: | Supplier | number | format: |
| Global             | nan      | nan    | NNNNN   |

The supplier must provide the barcode (EAN13 and GTIN).

The

barcode must be unique for each product number (i.e. Suppliers must not reuse barcodes).

• For products consisting of several component boxes each component box must have a separate barcode.

• For assorted products, all variants must have the same barcode.

The barcode size must comply with GS1 requirements stated in Table 4.

Note: Low print quality or rough surfaces require larger barcodes.

| ('Size factor', 'Size factor', 'Size factor')   |   ('EAN-13 Size [mm]', 'Width Incl. Light zone', 'Width Incl. Light zone') |   ('EAN-13 Size [mm]', 'Height', '(Excl. numbers)') |   ('EAN-13 Size [mm]', 'Light zone Left', 'Light zone Left') |   ('EAN-13 Size [mm]', 'Light zone Right', 'Light zone Right') |
|:------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------:|----------------------------------------------------:|-------------------------------------------------------------:|---------------------------------------------------------------:|
| Min: 0,8                                        |                                                                       2983 |                                                1828 |                                                          290 |                                                            185 |
| 10                                              |                                                                       3729 |                                                2285 |                                                          363 |                                                            231 |
| Max: 2,0 Note:                                  |                                                                       7458 |                                                4570 |                                                          726 |                                                            462 |

JYSK products must contain:

1. Permanent marking according to 2.1.

• If permanent marking is not practicable, the supplier must confirm an acceptable solution with JYSK C&Q.

2. Applicable specific labelling according to chapter 5.

Permanent marking is information intended to remain on the product during the entire lifetime. The marking must follow legal requirements and requirements for traceability.

Permanent marking must:

1. Contain information according to Table 5 applied according one of the application methods stated in Table 6.

2. Be adapted (e.g. size, shape and color) to the product in accordance with JYSK guidelines.

3. Remain attached and legible throughout the lifetime of the product when subjected to normal and foreseeable use.

4. The label must be securely attached and not removeable to the external surface of the item, so that it is visible,

legible and indelibly to any person inspecting the article.

5. It is permissible to attach the label to the underside of the item, e.g. under a chair.

6. It is permissible to use a self-adhesive label if it meets all requirements.

Permanent labeling is not required for single use products as:

• Paper napkins

• Gift ribbons and wrapping paper

• Disposable cloths

• Cleaning sponges

Page 5/20

Minimum size of label W30 x H15 mm, information must always be readable.

The shape and dimensions of the label can be adjusted to fit the product and area for placement.

Recommended size W40 x H20 mm.

Page 6/20

Sales units must comply with JYSK 6201 - Packaging Design Guideline.

Sales units must contain:

1. Labelling of information according to Table 7

• Texts must be legible (with normal eyesight) from the distance which users need to read them.

2. Applicable Specific labelling according to chapter 5

*Note: Textile products where the care label with order number and batch number is visible without the need to remove any packaging e.g. a towel, is excepted from requiring batch number and PO number on the sales unit.

**Note: For “made in Turkey”, the spelling must be “Türkiye”.

The Arabic product description must include “made in [country of origin]” in Arabic language. It must be placed in continuation of the Arabic product description.

Labelling directly on the product that is not part of the permanent marking (see 2.1) must:

1. Be easily removable

2. Not leave marks on the product

Page 7/20

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Alternative line breaks to importer information must comply with Table 8 – other line breaks are not allowed.

(Write on one line, using automatic line-breaks fitting to the layout) | nan                                                       | 1Byb G0 dyginve 4P%.ay20)] TYSK wlSy aac 4a; 3 pd) 8)3l Blbll jlull cayleall (Gysodl) cll |

The alternative line break for labelling for food contact materials in Table 9 is the minimum line break. Is it approved to make a

line break that fits the text better, if possible.

| Unnamed: 0    | Gida ile temasa uygundur                            | Gida ile temasa uygundur.1                         |
|:--------------|:----------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------|
| ling for food | ANONIM SiRKETIi.                                    | TICARET ANONIM SiRKETI. Adresi: Cevizli Mah. Tuga\ |
| act materials | Adresi: Cevizli Mah. Tugay Yolu Cad. No: 69 Maltepe | Yolu Cad. No: 69 Maltepe Piazza Maltepe/istanbul.  |

TİCARET ANONİM ŞİRKETİ. Adresi: Cevizli Mah. Tugay

Labelling for food

Table 9 - Alternative line break for food contact materials

Page 8/20

Handling unit & unit loads must contain:

1. Labelling of information according to Table 10 on minimum two adjacent sides

• The labelling must be uncovered and easily locatable (i.e. not hidden by additional packaging materials)

• Minimum size of label 150 x 200 mm (The format can be adapted to actual size of handling unit)

2. Applicable Specific labelling according to chapter 5

|   Order | Header format:       | Information                                             |
|--------:|:---------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------|
|       1 | JYSK order no.:      | PO number                                               |
|       2 | Batch no.:           | Batch number                                            |
|       3 | JYSK Product Number: | Product number(s) according to 1.1 in Bold text         |
|       4 | JYSK product text:   | Product type and Product name in Bold text              |
|       5 | Size/model:          | Size/model/type of the product (in English only)        |
|       6 | Color/material:      | In text (in English only) or a color label              |
|       7 | Quantity:            | Number of sales units within the unit                   |
|       8 | Barcode:             | Same barcode (according to 1.3) as contained sales unit |
|       9 | Gross weight:        | Weight of unit including packaging in kg in Bold text   |

•

Handling units including a sales display see (JYSK 6002) must be marked ‘SDP’

• Handling units containing smaller handling units must be marked ‘MASTERBOX’

Suppliers must apply relevant specific labelling according to a contingency approach:

• Labelling required by this standard.

• Labelling required by other JYSK Guidelines or standards.

• Labelling required by legislation.

• Labelling required by harmonized or referenced standards.

Plastic bags with an opening perimeter ≥360 mm included in sales units and master bags in handling units, must have a warning printed/attached outside to avoid any risk of suffocation for children.

Note: Additional specific labelling requirements may apply to certain products intended for children!

The warning type must be minimum one of the following:

1. Contain perforation of minimum 1% of the area measured over any 30x30 mm of the bag

2. Warning text

• The warning text must be framed and well-arranged

• The warning text must be translated to all languages which are made available as JYSK 10114

3. Warning symbol printed directly on the bag

• Symbol made available as JYSK 60005

• Symbol size WxH: 4x2 cm

• On bags >50 cm: the symbol must be printed intermitted max distance between symbols 30 cm

Units having a risk of product-damage if opened with a knife must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60001.

Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from JYSK C&Q.

All packaging components must contain recycling symbols in accordance with JYSK

6001.

Symbols are available as JYSK 60010.

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Suppliers must apply the TRIMAN symbol integrated with Info-tri in accordance with Table 11. Info-tri must be applied according to JYSK 6201.

| Application                            | Packaging                                                           | . Textiles & Household linens                                         | Shoes                                               | EEE & Batteries                                                                     | products, furniture and | . bedding Heuse articles                                                          | Decorative 7 textiles                                             | DIY, jardenin g 9 products and toys                                                                       |
|:---------------------------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Marking - location                     | Must be printed on h the packaging itself                           | Care label                                                            | Must be integrated with permanent marking (See 2.1) | Manual (If no physical manual is included the . Info-tri must be on the sales unit) | Assembly Instruction (If no physical Al is included . the Info-tri must be on the care label or sales unit) | Care label                                                        | Assembly Instruction (If no physical Al is included the Info-tri must be on the care label or sales unit) |
| Apply to but Pply to bu not limited to | R fabl ecyc! a e packaging materials (One marking per oe packaging) | Household linens Pillowcases and duvet over Mattress d: pacs Bathmats

| Shoes                                               | Batteries . Electronic equipment Battery lamps v Ps LED candles                     | Furniture . Air mattresses | Cushions Mattresses and top mattresses Duvets and pillows                      | Window dressing (incl. ready- made curtains) Rugs Shower curtains | Parasols and bases - Pavilions and gazebos Planters and flower pots Toys                                  |
| Specifications in                      | 5.4.1                                                               | 5.4.2                                                                 | 5.4.2                                               | 5.4.3                                                                               | 5.4.4                                                                                                       | 5.4.5                                                             | 5.4.6                                                                                                     |

The symbol must have a suitable size between 10 and 40 mm.

Note: The round TRIMAN symbol may have a size of minimum 6 mm if ‘technically constrained’ (e.g. packaging of

small size), where the box + text then is minimum 11.6 mm high.

Note: Material symbol and TRIMAN must have the same height, see 6.

The color must be ‘Monochrome’ (Black)

Info-tri for packaging must be made in accordance with JYSK 65000 – ‘Chapter 03 Marketed in France and abroad’ using the ‘templates’ JYSK 60020 or JYSK 60021 and the ‘packaging component silhouettes’ JYSK 60022

• ‘Packaging component’ and ‘Packaging

waste stream’ must be represented using ‘pictogram only’

• For packaging with more than 3 packaging elements suppliers may use text instead of packaging component silhouettes

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Overview of available download Info-tri files for packaging in a standard version and compact version. A(.pdf) B(.ai)

Info-tri information for textiles, household linens and shoes must be made in accordance with JYSK 65002.

• The ‘product category’ must be ‘Home textiles’

• Rugs, window dressing and shower curtains are categorized as decorative textiles under furniture and bedding, See Table 11.

• The info-tri must include the URL link to Ademe’s website ‘quefairedemesdechets.fr’

• The labelling must include no additional French texts (besides the link)

Info-tri for textiles, household linens and shoes must be printed on the care label.

Overview of available download Info-tri files for packaging in a standard version and compact version. A(.pdf) B(.ai)

Overview of available download Info-tri files for textiles.

Page 13/20

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Info-tri for EEE and batteries must be made in accordance with JYSK 65003. Using the template JYSK 60051

• The symbol (signage) must be ‘Crossed-out bin’

• The ‘Product concerned, and its additional elements’ must be adapted to the actual product – See examples:

| 0                                                                 | 1                                                               |
|:------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------|
| This device is recyclable                                         | Cet appareil se recycle                                         |
| This device and its accessories are recyclable                    | Cet appareil et ses accessoires se recyclent                    |
| This device and its cord are recyclable                           | Cet appareil et son cordon se recyclent                         |
| This device and its primary batteries are recyclable              | Cet appareil et ses piles se recyclent                          |
| This device and its secondary batteries are recyclable            | Cet appareil et sa batterie se recyclent                        |
| This device, its accessories and cords are recyclable             | Cet appareil, ses accessoires et cordons se recyclent           |
| This device, its accessories and batterie are recyclable          | Cet appareil, ses accessoires et piles se recyclent             |
| This device, its cords and batterie are recyclable                | Cet appareil, ses cordons et batter

ie se recyclent              |
| This device, its accessories, cords, and batterie are recyclable  | Cet appareil, ses accessoires, cordons et batterie se recyclent |
| This device, its accessories, batteries, and cords are recyclable | Cet appareil, ses accessoires et cordons se recyclent           |

• Info-tri must include the ‘additional information’: ‘Points de collecte sur www.quefairedemesdechets.fr’

• ‘Electrical and electronic equipment’ (EEE) and ‘batteries and accumulators’ (B&A) marked with the ‘crossed out wheel bin’ does not need Info-tri labeling. However, the packaging must always carry the Info-tri symbol.

Info-tri for EEE and/or batteries must be printed either in the product manual/instruction or on the WEEE- instruction/sheet.

Page 14/20

Info-tri for Furniture products are made available horizontally as JYSK 60024 and vertically as JYSK 60025.

Info-tri for Decorative textile products are made available horizontally JYSK 60063 as and vertically as JYSK 60064.

Info-tri for DIY, gardening products and toys are made available horizontally JYSK 60065 as and vertically as JYSK 60066.

Page 15/20

Units with orientation limitations must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60002.

Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from JYSK C&Q.

Sales units and handling units weighing ≥25 kg must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60004.

Applied heavy unit symbols must have size of 100x100 mm.

Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from CAM.

Sales- and handling units weighing ≥25 kg requires approval by JYSK Human Resource due to working environment legislation. Sales- and handling units exceeding 50 kg can normally not get an approval.

Handling units containing Lithium batteries must contain labelling in accordance with JYSK 4005.

For products requiring CE-marking the CE-mark must be permanently marked on the product and packaging.

CE-markings must be correctly proportioned and have a height ≥5 mm.

Symbol is made available for download as JYSK 10071.

Note: For more information on CE-marking see JYSK General Requirements.

The CMim-marking (Morocco Conformity Assessed) is a Moroccan product marking that must be used for all Electrical Products and Toy products.

For product requiring CMim-marking the CMim-mark must be permanently marked on the product and packaging.

CMim-markings must be correctly proportioned and have a height ≥6 mm.

Symbol is made available for download as JYSK 10073. Notes: For more information on CMim-marking see JYSK General Requirements. Electrical products with UK-plug are not in scope.

FSC certified products and packaging must be marked with FSC logo and license code.

The use of FSC trademark must follow FSC-STD-50-001 V2-1.

FSC labels may be used in portrait or landscape formats.

FSC labels must be printed at a size at which all elements are legible.

FSC label text must be in English.

The minimum size for the label must be:

a) In portrait format: 9 mm in width, recommended min. 17 mm in width.

b) In landscape format: 6 mm in height, recommended min. 12 mm

in height.

Products and Packaging made from FSC certified materials (See required scope in JYSK General Requirements) must be labelled with FSC logo and license code in accordance with Table 13.

a) FSC certified products must carry the FSC logo with the license code of the supplier.

b) FSC certified packaging materials must carry the FSC logo with the license code of the packaging supplier. Notes: In case of packaging-materials the license code to be applied will in most cases be the printer. Application of incorrect license code can critical/costly - FSC Denmark has published the following guide on correct labelling: FSC Guide

The FSC logo must always be printed with the license code.

Note: License code are always in the format FSC-CXXXXXX.

The FSC logo must be with ‘™’

Note: ‘™’ is required instead of ‘®’ because the logo is not a registered trademark in all countries.

Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

| Component/ material:   | Component/ material:.1                                                                                                               | Apply packaging FSC-label on the component/ material?   | Apply product FSC-label on the packaging component/ material? (If product is certified)   |
|:-----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Sales packaging        | e Cartons/boxes e Bellybands e Hangtags e Clamps/U-cards ¢ Header cards ¢ Inserts Pamphlets ¢ Labels .                               | Yes Yes If the product is FSC-certified: No No          | Yes                                                                                       |
| Sales packaging        | nan                                                                                                                                  | nan                                                     | nan                                                                                       |
| Sales packaging        | ¢ Stickers ¢ Stiffeners                                                                                                              | Yes                                                     | nan                                                                                       |
| Sales packaging        | e Filler materials, corner protectors, honeycomb etc. e Handling unit                                                                | No                                                      | No                                                                                        |
| Transport packaging    | cartons/boxes e Sales displays e Filler materials, corner protection, Honeycomb etc. e Cut protection ¢ Carboard tubes e Slip sheets | Yes No                                                  | No                                                                                        |
| Instructions           | & manuals                                                                                                                            | No                                                      | Yes                                                                                       |

Logos must be placed on the packaging components/materials in accordance with JYSK 6201.

Page 18/20

If there are more than one chair in a box, there must be supplied one assembly instruction (AI) and one separate set of fittings for each chair, to sell only one piece from the box.

The AI must be packed in the bag, either together with the seat or with the backrest, and secured not to fall out.

The fitting bag/box must be fastened to the legs or seat.

JYSK require a clear instruction, showing which parts needed to hand out one complete chair to the customer.

This instruction must be printed on the inside flap of the box, so it becomes visible when opening the box.

Material symbol (JYSK 6001) and TRIMAN (5.4) symbols must have the same height, see Figure 1.

JYSK STANDARD General labelling requirements
This standard describes definitions and general requirements for labeling of products and packaging.
Section Changes 5.4 Heading updated in Table 11 to: Household products, furniture and bedding. 5.4.4 Heading updated to: Household products, furniture and bedding.

1 Terms and definitions
The terms and definitions in Table 1 apply for the purpose of this document.

Handling units can be in the form of e.g. cardboard box, a plastic bag or foiled pre-packs. Product name The name of the product provided by JYSK. Product number The reference number of the product in JYSK ERP system. The format of product numbers must comply with 1.1. The units (product and packaging) JYSK sell to retail customers.
A sales unit may consist of separate components.
Note: Some sales units also act as handling units.
Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Supplier number   The reference number of the supplier in JYSK ERP system.   The format of supplier numbers must comply with 1.2.   Unit load   A distribution unit containing one or several Sales units or several Handling units packaged on a load carrier   (i.e. pallet or slip-sheet).
Note: *Alternative line breaks, see 3.1.
1.1 JYSK Product number formats
JYSK product number must follow the format stated in Table 2.
Applicable region: Product number format: Global (Nordic & DBL) NNNNNNN/DDDDDDDD Nordic only NNNNNNN
• NNNNNNN is the Nordic product number (7 digits)
DDDDDDDD is the DBL product number (8 digits)
Note: JYSK use two product numbers on global products due to separate ERP (SAP) systems in Nordic and DBL.
DBL numbers can only be created after:
1) The PIF has been returned and approved by JYSK.
2) The product is listed for DBL region.
JYSK will not be able to inform the DBL numbers until the day after above has been met.
1.2 JYSK Supplier number format
JYSK supplier number must follow the format stated in Table 3.
Applicable region: Supplier number format: Global NNNNN Table 3
The supplier must provide the barcode (EAN13 and GTIN).
The barcode must be unique for each product number (i.e. Suppliers must not reuse barcodes).
• For products consisting of several component boxes each component box must have a separate barcode.
• For assorted products, all variants must have the same barcode.
The barcode size must comply with GS1 requirements stated in Table 4.
Note: Low print quality or rough surfaces require larger barcodes.

Size factor Width Incl. Light zone EAN-13 Size [mm] Height (Excl. numbers) Light zone Left Light zone Right Min: 0,8 29,83 18,28 2,90 1,85 1,0 37,29 22,85 3,63 2,31 Max: 2,0 74,58 45,70 7,26 4,62 Note:
Barcode height may be reduced to minimum 15 mm if the packaging size constitutes a technical constraint.
Table 4 – Barcode sizes
Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
JYSK products must contain:
1. Permanent marking according to 2.1.
• If permanent marking is not practicable, the supplier must confirm an acceptable solution with JYSK C&Q.
2. Applicable specific labelling according to chapter 5.
Permanent marking is information intended to remain on the product during the entire lifetime. The marking must follow legal requirements and requirements for traceability.
1. Contain information according to Table 5 applied according one of the application methods stated in Table 6.
2. Be adapted (e.g. size, shape and color) to the product in accordance with JYSK guidelines.
3. Remain attached and legible throughout the lifetime of the product when subjected to normal and foreseeable use.
4. The label must be securely attached and not removeable to the external surface of the item, so that it is visible,
legible and indelibly to any person inspecting the article.
5. It is permissible to attach the label to the underside of the item, e.g. under a chair.
6. It is permissible to use a self-adhesive label if it meets all requirements.

•  JYSK logo    •  JYSK Company information   •  Product number(s) according to 1.1   •  Supplier number(s) according to 1.2   •  Batch number   •  PO number    •  Electronical contact address: JYSK.com   For products marked with CE (See 5.8):   •  JYSK UK-importer information
Table 5 - Permanent marking information

On a label:   Directly on product:   •  Pasted label (See 2.1.1)   •  Printed or stamped with waterproof ink   •  Label placement must fulfill the following criteria:   •  Etched   1.  Not visible during regular use of product   •  Branded   2.  Easily locatable if needed   •  Moulded   •  Included on care label according to JYSK 4004    •  Laser engraved   •  Included on rating-label/plate
Table 6 – Permanent marking application methods
Permanent labeling is not required for single use products as:
• Gift ribbons and wrapping paper

The shape and dimensions of the label can be adjusted to fit the product and area for placement.

3 Sales unit labelling
Sales units must comply with JYSK 6201 - Packaging Design Guideline.
Sales units must contain:
1. Labelling of information according to Table 7
• Texts must be legible (with normal eyesight) from the distance which users need to read them.
2. Applicable Specific labelling according to chapter 5

•  Product number(s) according to 1.1   •  Supplier number(s) according to 1.2   •  Batch number*    •  PO number*   •  Product name   •  Product type in all JYSK languages   •  Material content in all JYSK languages   •  Dimension   •  Barcode according to 1.3   •  Country of origin (English only)**   •  JYSK company information   •  JYSK UK-importer information   •  JYSK Morocco-importer information   •  JYSK Türkiye Information according to Table 1
Table 7 – Information on sales units

*Note: Textile products where the care label with order number and batch number is visible without the need to remove any packaging e.g. a towel, is excepted from requiring batch number and PO number on the sales unit.
**Note: For “made in Turkey”, the spelling must be “Türkiye”.
The Arabic product description must include “made in [country of origin]” in Arabic language. It must be placed in continuation of the Arabic product description.
Labelling directly on the product that is not part of the permanent marking (see 2.1) must:
1. Be easily removable
2. Not leave marks on the product

4 Handling unit & unit load labelling
Handling unit & unit loads must contain:
1. Labelling of information according to Table 10 on minimum two adjacent sides
• The labelling must be uncovered and easily locatable (i.e. not hidden by additional packaging materials)
• Minimum size of label 150 x 200 mm (The format can be adapted to actual size of handling unit)
2. Applicable Specific labelling according to chapter 5
Example of labelling on two adjacent sides

Order Header format: Information 1 JYSK order no.: PO number 2 Batch no.: Batch number 3 JYSK Product Number: Product number(s) according to 1.1 in Bold text 4 JYSK product text: Product type and Product name in Bold text 5 Size/model: Size/model/type of the product (in English only) 6 Color/material: In text (in English only) or a color label 7 Quantity: Number of sales units within the unit 8 Barcode: Same barcode (according to 1.3) as contained sales unit 9 Gross weight: Weight of unit including packaging in kg in Bold text
• Handling units including a sales display see (JYSK 6002) must be marked ‘SDP’
• Handling units containing smaller handling units must be marked ‘MASTERBOX’
Table 10 - Information on handling unit and unit loads
Edition 34 – 2025-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
Suppliers must apply relevant specific labelling according to a contingency approach:
• Labelling required by this standard.
• Labelling required by other JYSK Guidelines or standards.
• Labelling required by legislation.
• Labelling required by harmonized or referenced standards.
Plastic bags with an opening perimeter ≥360 mm included in sales units and master bags in handling units, must have a warning printed/attached outside to avoid any risk of suffocation for children.
Note: Additional specific labelling requirements may apply to certain products intended for children!
The warning type must be minimum one of the following:
1. Contain perforation of minimum 1% of the area measured over any 30x30 mm of the bag
• The warning text must be framed and well-arranged
• The warning text must be translated to all languages which are made available as JYSK 10114
3. Warning symbol printed directly on the bag
• Symbol made available as JYSK 60005
• Symbol size WxH: 4x2 cm
• On bags >50 cm: the symbol must be printed intermitted max distance between symbols 30 cm
Example of ‘Plastic bag warning’ symbol
5.2 Do not open with a knife
Units having a risk of product-damage if opened with a knife must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60001.
Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from JYSK C&Q.
Example of ‘Do not open with a knife’ symbol
All packaging components must contain recycling symbols in accordance with JYSK 6001.
Symbols are available as JYSK 60010.
Examples of recycling labels.

5.4.2 Info-tri for Textiles, household linens & shoes
Info-tri information for textiles, household linens and shoes must be made in accordance with JYSK 65002.
• The ‘product category’ must be ‘Home textiles’
• Rugs, window dressing and shower curtains are categorized as decorative textiles under furniture and bedding, See Table 11.
• The info-tri must include the URL link to Ademe’s website ‘quefairedemesdechets.fr’
• The labelling must include no additional French texts (besides the link)
Info-tri for textiles, household linens and shoes must be printed on the care label.

5.4.3 Info-tri for EEE & Batteries
Info-tri for EEE and batteries must be made in accordance with JYSK 65003. Using the template JYSK 60051
• The symbol (signage) must be ‘Crossed-out bin’
• The ‘Product concerned, and its additional elements’ must be adapted to the actual product – See examples:

• Info-tri must include the ‘additional information’: ‘Points de collecte sur www.quefairedemesdechets.fr’

5.5 Units with orientation limitations
Units with orientation limitations must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60002.
Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from JYSK C&Q.
CAUTION IT THIS SIDE UP
Sales units and handling units weighing ≥25 kg must contain the symbol made available as JYSK 60004.
Applied heavy unit symbols must have size of 100x100 mm.
Suppliers must apply the symbol only with preapproval from CAM.
Sales- and handling units weighing ≥25 kg requires approval by JYSK Human Resource due to working environment legislation. Sales- and handling units exceeding 50 kg can normally not get an approval.

For products requiring CE-marking the CE-mark must be permanently marked on the product and packaging.
CE-markings must be correctly proportioned and have a height ≥5 mm.
Symbol is made available for download as JYSK 10071.
Note: For more information on CE-marking see JYSK General Requirements.
5.9 CMim-marking (Morocco Conformity Assessed)
The CMim-marking (Morocco Conformity Assessed) is a Moroccan product marking that must be used for all Electrical Products and Toy products.
For product requiring CMim-marking the CMim-mark must be permanently marked on the product and packaging.
CMim-markings must be correctly proportioned and have a height ≥6 mm.
Symbol is made available for download as JYSK 10073. Notes: For more information on CMim-marking see JYSK General Requirements. Electrical products with UK-plug are not in scope.
FSC certified products and packaging must be marked with FSC logo and license code.
The use of FSC trademark must follow FSC-STD-50-001 V2-1.
FSC mix Wood from responabie sources FSC™ C000000
FSC labels may be used in portrait or landscape formats.
FSC labels must be printed at a size at which all elements are legible.
FSC label text must be in English.
The minimum size for the label must be:
a) In portrait format: 9 mm in width, recommended min. 17 mm in width.
b) In landscape format: 6 mm in height, recommended min. 12 mm in height.
Products and Packaging made from FSC certified materials (See required scope in JYSK General Requirements) must be labelled with FSC logo and license code in accordance with Table 13.
a) FSC certified products must carry the FSC logo with the license code of the supplier.

b) FSC certified packaging materials must carry the FSC logo with the license code of the packaging supplier. Notes: In case of packaging-materials the license code to be applied will in most cases be the printer. Application of incorrect license code can critical/costly - FSC Denmark has published the following guide on correct labelling: FSC Guide
The FSC logo must always be printed with the license code.
Note: License code are always in the format FSC-CXXXXXX.
The FSC logo must be with ‘™’
Note: ‘™’ is required instead of ‘®’ because the logo is not a registered trademark in all countries.

If there are more than one chair in a box, there must be supplied one assembly instruction (AI) and one separate set of fittings for each chair, to sell only one piece from the box.
The AI must be packed in the bag, either together with the seat or with the backrest, and secured not to fall out.
The fitting bag/box must be fastened to the legs or seat.
JYSK require a clear instruction, showing which parts needed to hand out one complete chair to the customer.
This instruction must be printed on the inside flap of the box, so it becomes visible when opening the box.
